column2: TENNESSEE DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Tennessee
column6: TN

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: when a child is about to run into the street.
column6: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 2. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column8: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

column2: 3. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is about to stop.
column6: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column8: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.

column2: 4. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: come to a complete stop.

column2: 5. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column4: improve traffic flow.
column6: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
column8: help create a safe driving environment.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column8: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Watch for vehicles entering from the side
column6: Winding road ahead
column8: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Stop Sign Ahead
column6: No Right Turn
column8: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 9. The extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
column4: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.
column6: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.
column8: other drivers when merging onto a freeway.

column2: 10. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column6: call the fire department immediately.
column8: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

column2: 11. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column8: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 12. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: quick lane changes without a signal.
column6: chasing or challenging other drivers.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column4: Curve ahead, drive at 40 MPH ot more around the curve ahead
column6: Curve ahead, the recommended speed is 40 MPH or less
column8: If you are driving at 40 MPH or less you must stay in the right-hand lane

column2: 14. A flashing red light means:
column4: Drive with caution.
column6: The light will soon change to steady red.
column8: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 15. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column6: No.
column8: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 16. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.
column6: before you enter the intersection.
column8: at the next crosswalk.

column2: 17. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column6: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column8: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.

column2: 18. While you are in the middle of an intersection about to turn left, the light turns red. You should:
column4: stop until you have the green light.
column6: complete the turn when traffic clears.
column8: back out of the intersection, if possible.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road
column6: Sharp turn to the left
column8: Low shoulder

column2: 20. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 21. Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
column4: impair your judgment.
column6: help you to be a better driver.
column8: make you feel better.

column2: 22. A flashing red light:
column4: is used at dangerous intersections.
column6: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 23. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the right.
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 24. When you see an overhead lane sign with an arrow and the word "ONLY" below it, you should:
column4: change lanes immediately.
column6: go the direction of the arrow.
column8: proceed only if you plan on turning left.

column2: 25. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column6: Motorcycles are hard to see.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 26. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 27. This road sign is:
column4: a regulatory sign.
column6: a warning sign.
column8: a speed reduction sign.

column2: 28. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: anticipate errors by other drivers.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 29. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.
column6: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column8: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 30. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
